Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: now that you started the daemon with your pubkey you can sweep everything to your backedupaddress

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: ./komodo-cli sendtoaddress ADDRESS "" "" true

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
there is also e -donation parameter in case you want to send all rewards to one specific address
docs.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/installations/common-runtime-parameters.html#donation

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: `od -d /dev/random` seemed to output lots of numbers.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo you cloned the exact entropy of the same machine 4 times

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: all the saved entropy

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: cat /dev/random > /dev/null for a while to throw away entropy

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's usually regenerated with network activity, keyboard and mouse, other random stuff. You didn't give the machine enough time to generate it's own entropy, all the machines basically had the same

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: power cycling the VM should help the entropy as well

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this kind of thing happens a lot, I have seen people complain about a similar error when test suites are supposed to do things in random order, or use a random seed, or something like that, but they don't, because the test suite VM was cloned and doesn't have it's own entropy
